properties.areaDesc: Southern Brevard County; Martin; Northern Brevard County; St. Lucie; Indian River; Coastal Volusia
properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 21 at 3:24AM EST until January 21 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Melbourne FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Rough, choppy surf, with breaking waves up to 5 feet, a
strong southward flowing longshore current, and rip currents
near piers and jetties are expected.

* WHERE...Southern Brevard, Indian River, St. Lucie, Martin,
Coastal Volusia and Northern Brevard Counties.

* WHEN...Through 7 pm this evening.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surf conditions. Rip currents
may sweep even strong swimmers away from shore and into deeper
water. The next low tide cycle along the east central Florida
coast will occur around 200 PM and will be the peak time for rip
currents.
properties.instruction:
Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and
float. Don't swim against the current. If able, swim in a
direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the
shore and call or wave for help.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING
